concept.title: NodeJS
concept.shortdesc: NodeJS, also called Node.js or, short: Node, is a runtime environment for JavaScript. You can run it from the command line using the node command.

conbody.p: You can use it to run applications written in JavaScript. Furthermore, it exposes APIs that enable applications to access native functionality such as the file system and much more.

section.title: The command line interface
section.p: To run a JS file with Node, simply run node [JS file location] in your command line. It's also possible to open an interactive REPL (Read-eval-print loop) by just running node without any arguments.
